fields.name: Filter Corpus
fields.description:
Filter corpus widget takes corpus as an input. There are five basic filter queries:
1. is equal query will only keep rows in dataset where value in a column matches the given phrase: 
example: column_name == phrase
2. is not equal query will only keep rows where value in a column does not match the given phrase:
example: column_name != phrase
3. is larger query. Same as above, only different operator. Works only on columns with numeric values:
example: column_name > 1
4. is smaller query. Same as above, only different operator.
example: column_name < 1
5. is in query. Will return a row if a phrase is inside a text in the column. Works only on text columns
example: phrase in column_name

fields.name: Query
fields.description: Define a query, click help to see how
